Activity: Arrive at the office, check emails and calendar for any urgent updates or meetings. Prioritize tasks for the week based on the project goals. Review week 3 goal: Abstracting influenza season data and prioritizing electronic records. Contact @da-1 and @da-2 to confirm data extraction plan and ensure alignment on target of 200 records per week.

Meet with @da-1 (Mateo Rodriguez) and @da-2 (Grace Ito) to discuss the data abstraction process for the influenza season 2023-2024. Clarify expectations for prioritizing electronic records and address any questions they may have. Discuss data sources and potential challenges.

Review EHR system documentation to understand data fields relevant to influenza tracking. Focus on identifying fields related to diagnosis, vaccination status, and relevant patient demographics. Prepare a list of relevant data fields for @da-1 and @da-2.

Draft an email to @ehrv-1 (EHR Vendor Liaison) requesting clarification on accessing specific data fields within the EHR system. Inquire about any known issues with data quality or access limitations. @ehrv-1 Topic: EHR Data Access and Quality for Influenza Data Abstraction.

Continue reviewing EHR system documentation and begin drafting a preliminary data abstraction form for @da-1 and @da-2 to use. Ensure the form includes all necessary data fields and clear instructions.

Schedule a brief meeting with @clinlead-1 (Clinical Lead) and @his-1 (Health Informatics Specialist) to discuss the clinical relevance of the abstracted data and ensure the data fields being collected are appropriate for influenza trend analysis. @clinlead-1, @his-1 Topic: Clinical Relevance of Influenza Data Abstraction.

Refine the data abstraction form based on feedback from @clinlead-1 and @his-1. Send the updated form to @da-1 and @da-2 for their review and feedback. Request they pilot test the form with a small sample of records.
Document today's activities and update the project plan with progress made. Review the plan for tomorrow and identify any outstanding tasks. Prepare for tomorrow's meeting.
